page.title: 17All Saints Parish Church
page.content: The Parish Church was founded in Anglo Saxon times, though now the earliest parts date back to the Norman Conquest. The Tower contains 8 bells, the oldest dating from 1616. For 25 years the bells were not rung because the noise exacerbated mining subsidence. The interior of the church is very impressive, with a 14th century nave and chancel. The church looked after the original parish of Darfield, which consisted of the 7 local villages. The churchyard contains some interesting graves. The most famous person buried there is Ebenezer Elliot a poet. The church also contains memorials to the men that died in th 1857 and 1886 local colliery disasters,when 199 men and boys were killed at the local pits.
